fields.value: Opening Pandora's Box: The Measurement of Average Wages

authorAffiliation.value: Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis

dsDescriptionValue.value: The data provide a description of the differences among the  most common methods for measuring average wages and an exploration of  how these differences can systematically change the answers to some  important questions about wages. The different characteristics of the  various measurement methods (average hourly earnings, compensation per  hour, or the employment cost index) make them suited to different purposes.
